byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from São Paulo.

abstract: Brazilian Vice Pres Michel Temer will not be subjected to investigation over claims he was involved in scandal surrounding oil company Petrobras, with officials citing lack of evidence; Temer has been positioning himself to replace Pres Dilma Rousseff if Senate votes to suspend her.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor general determined that the accusations against Mr. Temer were not substantial enough at this point to merit an inquiry.

headline.main: Brazil’s Vice President, Michel Temer, Won’t Face Inquiry Over Petrobras
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Vice President  Won’t Face Graft Inquiry

snippet: The prosecutor general determined that the accusations against Mr. Temer were not substantial enough at this point to merit an inquiry.
